channel.title: hl on Applied Choice Research Group
channel.description: Recent content in hl on Applied Choice Research Group

item.description: Hanjin Li is a Ph.D. student at Economics Division of the University of Stirling, supervised by Dr Seda Erdem and Prof Danny Campbell. Her research area mainly focuses on choice modelling and financial decision-making. Her research interests include the use of behavioural economics theory to explore individuals’ financial decision-making, and the application of choice modelling to understand financial behaviour.
